thought: Implement mainWorkflow to connect the manual trigger, AI completion, and Slack message sending. The workflow will build the AI input message for the news title, call AI completion to get the category, then format and send the message to Slack #general channel.
plan: Receive trigger input from manual trigger.
Build AI input messages with system and user roles, including the news title.
Call AI completion action with the built messages.
Extract AI response category from AI output.
Format the Slack message with the news title and category.
Wrap the message in the required input format for Slack action.
Call Slack message send action with channel set to #general.
Return Slack action output as workflow output.
criticism: Currently, the workflow is not implemented, so it cannot run or produce results. The AI input messages must be carefully constructed, and Slack message formatting must match user requirements exactly.

tool_input.code:
def trigger_0():
    """
    comments: This manual trigger is used to start the workflow on demand.
    TODOs: 
      - Test manual trigger activation.
      - Ensure output data format is correct.
    """
    params = {}
    function = transparent_trigger(integration="manualTrigger", resource="default", operation="default")
    output_data = function.run(input_data=None, params=params)
    return output_data


def action_0(input_data):
    """
    comments: Use AI completion to determine the category of the news title.
    TODOs: 
      - Build AI input messages in mainWorkflow.
      - Test AI completion output format.
    """
    params = {}
    function = transparent_action(integration="aiCompletion", resource="default", operation="default")
    output_data = function.run(input_data=input_data, params=params)
    return output_data


def action_1(input_data):
    """
    comments: Send the categorized news title and category to Slack #general channel.
    TODOs: 
      - Set channel to #general.
      - Format Slack message properly.
      - Test Slack message sending.
    """
    params = {
        "select": "channel",
        "channelId": {"mode": "name", "value": "general"},
        "messageType": "text",
        "text": "={{$json[\"text\"]}}"
    }
    function = transparent_action(integration="slack", resource="message", operation="post")
    output_data = function.run(input_data=input_data, params=params)
    return output_data


def mainWorkflow(trigger_input: [{...}]):
    """
    comments: Workflow to categorize a news title using AI and send the result to Slack #general channel.
    TODOs: 
      - Build AI input messages with system and user roles.
      - Extract AI completion result.
      - Format Slack message correctly.
      - Test end-to-end workflow.
    """
    news_title = "Multiple snowstorms to bear down on Northeast, Ohio Valley in early December"

    # Build AI input messages
    ai_input = [{
        "json": {
            "messages": [
                {"role": "system", "content": "You are a helpful assistant that categorizes news titles into categories such as weather, sports, politics, technology, etc."},
                {"role": "user", "content": f"Categorize this news title: {news_title}"}
            ]
        }
    }]

    # Call AI completion
    ai_output = action_0(ai_input)

    # Extract category from AI response
    category = ai_output[0]["json"]["choices"][0]["text"].strip()

    # Format Slack message
    slack_message = f"News: {news_title}\nCategory: {category}"

    # Wrap message for Slack
    slack_input = [{"json": {"text": slack_message}}]

    # Send message to Slack
    slack_output = action_1(slack_input)

    return slack_output
